repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection consists of the academic papers of Edith O. Wallace, a professor at the University between 1918 and 1965.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Edith Owen Wallace was a faculty member and classics professor at the New York State College for Teachers, and the State University of New York at Albany for more than forty years. Born in Albany in 1896, Wallace attended the Milne School before received her B.A. from the New York State College for Teachers at Albany from 1913 to 1917. While at the State College for Teachers, Wallace was a founding member of Myskania. She later received an M.A. from Wellesley College and a Ph.D. from Columbia University. Wallace was hired by the college in 1918 as a Latin Instructor, a position she held until she was appointed as a professor in 1929, teaching courses in Greek, Latin and Comparative Literature. She continued to teach at the College and later University until her retirement in 1965.

During her time teaching in Albany, Wallace was a leader in the development of the College's M.A. in Latin program and the creation of the Department of Comparative Literature. She also served as Chair of the Department of Languages and Literature and as the Chair of the Division of Humanities during her time at the University. Wallace died in Albany in 1972. After Wallace's death, the Uptown campus' Humanities Building was renamed in her honor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection focuses on Wallace's writings as a student and as a professor, mostly related to her study of the Latin language. Collection includes Wallace's notebooks from her time as a college student, publications, manuscript typescripts, correspondence, press clippings, sheet music, photographic prints, and travel guides that Wallace retained.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection-level finding aid for collection completed in 2019 by Miles Lawlor. Most of the materials in the collection are in reused, unlabelled folders.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection was maintained in the original order after it was transferred.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by by Marion Wallace Goldring, Jr.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collection and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Edith Owen Wallace Papers, 1918-1960. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Wallace Papers).
